page.title: List of Athletic Bilbao records and statistics

revisions.rev:
'''[[Athletic Bilbao]]''' is a [[Spain|Spanish]] [[football (soccer)|football]] club. This page contains historical and current statistics and records pertaining to the club.
== Records ==
* One of the three clubs that have never been relegated from La Liga, along with [[FC Barcelona]] and [[Real Madrid]]. * Five-time La Liga and Copa del Rey winner in the same season. * First team to be permanently awarded the original Liga trophy. * Won La Liga unbeaten in the [[La Liga 1929-30|1929-30]] season (joint record). * Record for biggest Liga win, Athletic Club 12 Barcelona 1 in the [[La Liga 1930-31|1930-31]] Season. * Record for most goals scored in a league match (includes both sides), 14 with Athletic Club 9 [[Racing de Santander|Racing]] 5 in the [[La Liga 1932-33|1932-33]] Season. * Record for most goals scored in a league match as visitors, Osasuna 1 - Athletic 8 in the [[La Liga 1958-59|1958-59]] season (joint record). * Record for a draw with the most goals in a league match, AtlÃ©tico 6 - Athletic 6 ([[La Liga 1949-50|1949-50]] season). * All-time Liga goalscorer (as a fraction) in the same season (home); with 5.44 goals per match in the [[La Liga 1930-31|1930-31]] season. * All-time Liga goalscorer (as a fraction) in the same season (away); with 3.11 goals per match in the [[La Liga 1931-32|1931-32]] season. * All-time Liga goalscorer (as a fraction) in one season; with 4.06 goals per match in the [[La Liga 1930-31|1930-31]] season. * Biggest away victories (in percentages) in one season with 8 out of 9, 89% in the [[La Liga 1932-33|1932-33]] season. * Biggest number of away points (percentage) in one season with 16 out of 18, 89%, in the [[La Liga 1932-33|1932-33]] season. * Of the current Primera DivisiÃ³n teams, heaviest defeats inflicted at home ground against Barcelona, Betis, Espanyol, Sporting, (Zaragoza, Tenerife, Salamanca, Merida, Lleida and Celta). * Of the current Primera DivisiÃ³n teams, heaviest Liga defeats inflicted away against Barcelona (0-6), Real Madrid (0-6), Espanyol (1-5) and Osasuna (1-8). * Leading goalscorer in a single league match, Bata: seven goals (Athletic Club 12 Barcelona 1. [[La Liga 1930-31|1930-31]] season, joint record). * Leading [[Pichichi trophy|goalscorer]] in the league the most times: [[Telmo Zarra]], six [[Pichichi trophy|Pichichi trophies]]. * Leading goalscorer in a single season: [[Telmo Zarra|Zarra]], 38 goals (joint record). * All-time goalscorer in the history of the Liga: [[Telmo Zarra|Zarra]], 253. * Player with most appearances in Primera DivisiÃ³n: [[Andoni Zubizarreta|Zubizarreta]], 622 (the first 169 matches with Athletic Club). * Team with greatest number of Copa del Rey final appearances (disputed): 35. * Four permanently awarded league trophies (joint record). * Most goals scored in a Copa del Rey competition: 12-1 against [[Celta de Vigo|Celta]]. * Player with most Copa del Rey final wins: [[AgustÃ­n GaÃ­nza|Gainza]], with seven. * Players with most Copa del Rey finals (disputed): [[AgustÃ­n GaÃ­nza|Gainza]] and Jose Mari Belauste, both has 9 confirmed wins. * All-time leading goalscorer in the history of the Copa del Rey: [[Telmo Zarra|Zarra]], 81 goals. * Leading goalscorer in a Copa del Rey match: [[AgustÃ­n GaÃ­nza|Gainza]], eight goals (Athletic 12 â Celta 1 during the [[La Liga 1946-47|1946-47]] season.). * Player with most Copa del Rey matches: [[AgustÃ­n GaÃ­nza|Gainza]], 99.

===Awards=== * '''Amberes Trophy (2):''' 1953, 1959 * '''Martini&Rossi Trophy (1):''' 1956 * '''[[Pichichi Trophy]] (12):''' 1930, 1931, 1932, 1940, 1945, 1946, 1947, 1950, 1951, 1953, 1968, 1975. * '''[[Zamora Trophy]] (6):''' 1930, 1934, 1936, 1941, 1947, 1970.
== Players == {{see also|List of Athletic Bilbao players}}{{complete|15 March 2010}}
Games only include professional matches. Substitute appearances are included. Statistics for current players are updated continuously throughout the year. Players are listed according to the date of their first-team debut for the club. Statistics are correct as of 15 March 2010.

=== Player records === ==== Pichichi winners====
The [[Pichichi Trophy|Pichichi]] is an award given by the Spanish newspaper [[MARCA]] to the top-scorer at the end of the league season.

==== Ricardo Zamora Trophy ====
The [[Ricardo Zamora Trophy]] is a [[association football|football]] award, established by Spanish newspaper [[MARCA]] in 1958. The award goes to the goalkeeper who has the lowest "goals-to-games" ratio.
